channel.title: Hiding Your Client Folder And Command Prompt || Run At Desktop! (With Pics)
channel.description:
[b][u]Today, I am going to teach you how to hide your Client folder and Command Prompt, so all you have to do is click "run"![/u][/b]
[i][u][b]Difficulty:[/b][/u][/i] For Beginners - 3/10 For Intermediates - 1/10 For Experts - .5/10
Bare with me folks, I am not an expert picture editer/taker, and this is my first Client tutorial! Please comment and rate me on how I did! Thank-You
Files Edited: "run" or "runclient" or whatever you have named your client
[b][i][u]Note: You Must Have A Gui.java Or EGUI.java in order for the "Command Prompt" to be hidden.[/u][/i][/b]
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ok, before I begin, I will be telling you what client base I am using. I am using the Pwnscape 3 Client.
[u][b]How To Hide The Command Prompt & Make "run" On Desktop[/b][/u]
..::Steps::.. (Pics) [b][u]Open up your Client folder, and drag the "run" to the Desktop.[/u][/b]
[img]http://img34.imageshack.us/img34/8315/79612676.png[/img] [img]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/6162/36241912.png[/img] Right Click "run", choose "edit", highlight all the text in it, delete, and replace with the code below pic.
[img]http://img20.imageshack.us/img20/6686/44418358.png[/img]
..::FOR Gui.java::.. [code]@echo off title Pwnscape Client cd Pwnscape Client cd Files start JavaW -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit[/code]
Add This If You Have Gui.java
Now, lets explain the code..
@echo off - Just leave this. title Pwnscape Client - Just leave, or just change name to yours, doesn't matter though. cd Pwnscape Client - Title of your client folder. cd Files - if you have another folder thats called "Files" with all the files in it, delete if you don't have. start JavaW -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui - Just leave this alone :). exit - exits the command prompt when loaded
..::FOR EGUI.java::.. [code]@echo off title Client start JavaW -Xmx800m EGUI exit[/code]
Add This Code If You Have EGUI.java
--------Test It, And Should Work :) Here Is Proof That It Works For Me------ [img]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/3071/22367094.png[/img] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u][i]Hiding The Client Folder And Making Archive Of It![/i][/u][/b]
[i][b][u]Difficulty:[/u][/b][/i] For Beginners: 1/10 For Intermediates: 0/10 For Experts: 0.00/10 (lol)
..::Steps::.. (Pics) [img]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/7282/99859027.png[/img] [img]http://img43.imageshack.us/img43/9604/42611378.png[/img] [img]http://img198.imageshack.us/img198/6418/19317929.png[/img] [img]http://img132.imageshack.us/img132/2967/17457819.png[/img] [img]http://img190.imageshack.us/img190/1218/47268398.png[/img] [img]http://img42.imageshack.us/img42/51/95638243.png[/img] [img]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/9585/40589335.png[/img] [img]http://img193.imageshack.us/img193/5696/25842728.png[/img]
Credits - 100% By Mott (me)
Remember to rate & comment on my first tutorial! Thanks Much!

item.title: Hiding Your Client Folder And Command Prompt || Run At Desktop! (With Pics)
item.dc:creator: @k4den k4den
item.description:
@k4den wrote:

lol i did this when i released my own client to the server i am mod on.

if the person has the “hide hidden folders” checked, it wont run.

i had to teamview about 10 people cos they are 13 year old, computer illiterate kids…

best to just release a non open source version of your client, or .jar it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding Your Client Folder And Command Prompt || Run At Desktop! (With Pics)
item.dc:creator: @shadow43 shadow43
item.description:
@shadow43 wrote:

@echo off title Pwnscape Client //your client name title cd Pwnscape Client //your client name cd Files //Change word Files to your client folder name start JavaW -Xmx800m EGUI exit

Try this Ebowne24

cd locates your clients folder so change ass i writed. Or just leave the .bat file and add this:

@echo off title Pwnscape Client //your client name title start JavaW -Xmx800m EGUI exit

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding Your Client Folder And Command Prompt || Run At Desktop! (With Pics)
item.dc:creator: @Xx_Mott_xX Xx Mott xX
item.description:
@Xx_Mott_xX wrote:

Today, I am going to teach you how to hide your Client folder and Command Prompt, so all you have to do is click “run”!

Difficulty:
For Beginners - 3/10
For Intermediates - 1/10
For Experts - .5/10

Bare with me folks, I am not an expert picture editer/taker, and this is my first Client tutorial! Please comment and rate me on how I did! Thank-You

Files Edited: “run” or “runclient” or whatever you have named your client

Note: You Must Have A Gui.java Or EGUI.java in order for the “Command Prompt” to be hidden.

Ok, before I begin, I will be telling you what client base I am using. I am using the Pwnscape 3 Client.

How To Hide The Command Prompt & Make “run” On Desktop

…::Steps::… (Pics)
Open up your Client folder, and drag the “run” to the Desktop.



Right Click “run”, choose “edit”, highlight all the text in it, delete, and replace with the code below pic.

…::FOR Gui.java::…

@echo off title Pwnscape Client cd Pwnscape Client cd Files start JavaW -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit

Add This If You Have Gui.java

Now, lets explain the code…

@echo off - Just leave this.
title Pwnscape Client - Just leave, or just change name to yours, doesn’t matter though.
cd Pwnscape Client - Title of your client folder.
cd Files - if you have another folder thats called “Files” with all the files in it, delete if you don’t have.
start JavaW -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui - Just leave this alone :).
exit - exits the command prompt when loaded

…::FOR EGUI.java::…

@echo off title Client start JavaW -Xmx800m EGUI exit

Add This Code If You Have EGUI.java

--------Test It, And Should Work Here Is Proof That It Works For Me------

Hiding The Client Folder And Making Archive Of It!

Difficulty:
For Beginners: 1/10
For Intermediates: 0/10
For Experts: 0.00/10 (lol)

…::Steps::… (Pics)







Credits - 100% By Mott (me)

Remember to rate & comment on my first tutorial! Thanks Much!

Read full topic
item.source: Hiding Your Client Folder And Command Prompt || Run At Desktop! (With Pics)
